intro: Dicliptera gillilandiorum, commonly known as the Gilliland's dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems in which it is found, though it is relatively understudied.
